p: The essential oils showing the best larvicidal activity against Ae. aegypti were Z. cornubracteatum rhizome essential oil from Bến En National Park (24-h LC 50 = 17.0 μg/mL) and Z. nudicarpum leaf essential oil from Pù Hoạt Nature Reserve (24-h LC 50 = 19.3 μg/mL). The rhizome essential oil of Z. cornubracteatum also demonstrated remarkable activity against Ae. albopictus (24-h LC 50 = 12.7 μg/mL). Both Z. nudicarpum leaf essential oil and rhizome essential oil were very active against Cx. quinquefasciatus larvae, with LC 50 values of 12.4 and 11.5 μg/mL, respectively.
